data.title: Portrait of a Man with a Medallion (1959)
data.meta_description: A man dreams of stampeding horses, only to be awoken by a note slipped under his door. Thereafter, he embarks on a strange journey, moving further into the unknown.
data.text:
A dreamy surrealist sequence that is rare and uncommon but deserving of your attention. It works entirely by its visual narrative. In one brief but compelling tale about false hopes, unreachable dreams, time, and place as barriers to ideal love, Witold Leszczynski sublimates the romantic film poetry of the 1950s, while creating an almost Heideggerian image of the Other. This appears to be something that would be utterly unforgettable, almost like in the context of a hypnagogic dream.

The film's title alludes to Sandro Botticelli's well-known painting "Portrait of a Young Man Holding a Medallion" (1475), which is also referenced as the picture from the opening scene. However, that painting isn't an exact replica of the original: the director addedâ€¦
